channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report X-2024041557
item.description:
Report X-2024041557

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: BELEN
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3525
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TILX 102029 was identified as releasing the commodity from the top of the rail car during switching operations in the BNSF Railway Belen, NM Terminal on 3/27/2024. Mechanical Hazmat Responder with a local hazmat contractor responded and identified the Syphon Pipe loose and requiring approximately + turn to secure the release. The total estimated amount released was approximately 3 gallons impacting the sides of the car, protective housing and minor impacts to the track/ties/ballast.
